intro: Rhomboda luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon rhombod, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
